alert.note: Alert for Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 28 at 12:23PM CST until January 29 at 6:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...SNOW EXPECTED TO CREATE HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS OVER PORTIONS OF EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN TONIGHT... .A low pressure system passing south of the area will bring a round of light snow to east-central Wisconsin late this afternoon and tonight. Northeast winds will bring added moisture from Lake Michigan, augmenting the snowfall over Manitowoc county. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches, with the highest totals near the lake. * WHERE...Manitowoc County. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads are likely to become snow covered and slippery, leading to hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty northeast winds could result in some blowing and drifting snow overnight, especially near the lake.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
